tool_description: Decimals Search is an irrational number search engine. It provides more 60 billion decimals of 8 irrational numbers (pi, e, sqrt(2), golden ratio, ln(2), ln(10), apery's constant, euler-mascheroni's constant). You can search a numeric string, count decimals and get any decimals !
name: Decimals Search
title: Decimals Search

api_list.name: /inaudi.php?number={number}&decimal={decimal}&display={display}

required_parameters.name: decimal
required_parameters.description: The n-th decimal that you want to know - 0 < n <= 10.000.000.000 if number is Pi else 0 < n <= 1.000.000.000

required_parameters.name: number
required_parameters.description: The irrational number (pi - e - sqrt2 - ln2 - ln10 - apery - phi - mascheroni). The default number is pi

optional_parameters.name: display
optional_parameters.description: Display the n next decimals - 0 < n <= 1000 - This parameter is optional

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://totodunet-decimals-search-v1.p.rapidapi.com/inaudi.php?number=pi&decimal=1&display=1000"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "totodunet-decimals-search-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://totodunet-decimals-search-v1.p.rapidapi.com/inaudi.php?number={number}&decimal={decimal}&display={display}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "totodunet-decimals-search-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: /inaudi.php?number={number}&search={search}&start={start}&end={end}
api_list.description: Get the first position of any numeric string

required_parameters.name: number
required_parameters.description: The irrational number (pi - e - sqrt2 - ln2 - ln10 - apery - phi - mascheroni). The default number is pi

required_parameters.name: search
required_parameters.description: The numeric string that you want to know his first position in decimals

optional_parameters.name: end
optional_parameters.description: The limit end (the default value is max value : 1.000.000.000)

optional_parameters.name: start
optional_parameters.description: Start to search (0 < n < end value) - the default value is 1

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://totodunet-decimals-search-v1.p.rapidapi.com/inaudi.php?number=pi&search=13051993&start=1&end=1000000000"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "totodunet-decimals-search-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://totodunet-decimals-search-v1.p.rapidapi.com/inaudi.php?number={number}&search={search}&start={start}&end={end}"

            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",

api_list.name: /inaudi.php?number={number}&count={count}&start={start}&end={end}
api_list.description: Count your number in decimals between start and end

required_parameters.name: count
required_parameters.description: The numeric string that you want count his occurency

required_parameters.name: number
required_parameters.description: The irrational number (pi - e - sqrt2 - ln2 - ln10 - zeta3 - phi - mascheroni). The default number is pi

optional_parameters.name: start
optional_parameters.description: Start to count (0 < n < end value) - the default value is 1

optional_parameters.name: end
optional_parameters.description: The limit end (the default value is max value : 1.000.000.000)

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://totodunet-decimals-search-v1.p.rapidapi.com/inaudi.php?number=pi&count=13&start=1&end=1000000000"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "totodunet-decimals-search-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
